data.title: MonoGame.Framework.iOS reference for ModelReader optimized away.
data.body: When creating a Xamarin iOS app, if you set the assembly linker to link all assemblies, The ModelReader gets optimized away. I've noticed that to prevent this, you have created instances like so var hStringReader = new StringReader(); ModelReader is missing a reference, so it gets optimized away. Additionally, is there any reason that you are not using the Preserve attribute instead (For all readers that are invoked dynamically). [Xamarin.iOS.Foundation.Preserve] Could you add the fact that the library has to be set to link sdks only to the nuget readme? Regards

data.title: Sprites don't appear when using layer depth and a magnified view
Vector4 docs
data.body:
Fully documented Vector4 struct,
+few fixes to other things
+tests
+added missing Transform overloads

data.title: SpriteBatch.Draw() applying random draw order to sprites with same layerDepth
data.body:
Situation:
Draw 2 sprites on top of each other for 500 times. Sprite 2 is smaller than sprite 1, so you always clearly see sprite 1 behind sprite 2. Make sure not to overlap the drawing for each sprite pair so you can evaluate each pair-drawing.

Notice that: in some cases you won't see sprite 2 above sprite 1 but only sprite 1.

Reason: using Draw() with SpriteSortMode = BackToFront and blendState = AlphaBlend will not always honor the injection-order when sprites are drawn out, even if they all have the same layerDepth.

Engine: MonoGame 3.4.0.456

data.title: Problems with Shaders (Win DX)
Add GraphicsCapabilities.SupportsVertexTextures
data.body: and use it to guard against applying vertex textures on devices that don't support them. Fixes #3828.

data.title: Problems with new effect preprocessor
[iOS] Fix engine to load into a child window.
data.body:
Hi,

I have a fix for that in my fork: https://github.com/lnaie/MonoGame
It doesn't impact the other platforms where could be also implemented gradually. Not ideal but it's a start.

Thanks

data.title: Structures should be serializable
data.body: A number of structures (Vector2/3/4 for example) are marked [Serializable] in Microsoft's XNA and are not in MonoGame. This should be changed for compatibility and just because it's helpful to have. I haven't looked more systematically at what does/doesn't match; Vector3 was what I ran into.

data.title: Monogame Linux Installer "broken"
data.body:
Hey all,

When using Monogame on Linux, the nuget package works perfectly, but I noticed that when I downloaded the 3.4 Linux download (Monogame.Linux.zip) from monogame.net, a few things were wrong. First, generate_deb.sh, makeself-header.sh, and makeself.sh are not marked as executable when unzipped. Second, the pipeline tool .deb generates with the version of 3.3-1, instead of 3.4. Is this intentional, or should it be changed?

data.title: Make OS X Pipeline use Gtk 3 instead of Gtk 2
data.body:
Linux Pipeline already uses Gtk 3 so there isn't much that has to be done. To be precise only 2 things:
1) Update dependencies, I've setup a PR to update most of them, (https://github.com/Mono-Game/MonoGame.Dependencies/pull/54), the only thing that remains to be updated is libgtk-3-0.dll, which I can't compile since I don't have a Mac
2) Setup #if and OS X constants in: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/Tools/Pipeline/Gtk/Gtk3Integration.cs

data.title: [Pipeline] Suppress unnecessary log messages
data.body:
This PR removes unnecessary/misleading "Skipping ..." messages from the build output.

Currently when an asset is referenced multiple times (e.g. a texture referenced by several models), it is built once and skipped in all subsequent build steps. The log message "Skipping TextureXyz" is printed multiple times in the build output.

This message adds unnecessary noise to the output. (In my case it adds ~2000 lines "Skipping TextureXyz" to the build output.)

The "Skipping ..." messages are also misleading: To see if an asset was built or skipped, the user has to search for the first appearance of the file in the build output. All subsequent messages are misleading.

data.title: [W8.1] SwapChainPanel support
data.body:
Discussion over at MonoGame community [link](http://community.monogame.net/t/w8-1-swapchainpanel-support/2433/2)

Basic implementation [here](https://github.com/Sparkiy/MonoGame/commit/125edb2c9170b23d4877c2c723cc9c12173fdef4)

That implementation is missing `Exit()` support as with SwapChainPanel you are not limited to just one instance of panel per application.

data.title: Improve The README.md
data.body:
We need to review and improve our existing README.md file:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/README.md

Some things I've noticed so far:
- The supported platforms is out of date.
- We shouldn't repeat download info from the website... just link them to it.
- Remove link to the old Starter Kits.
- Does anyone ever really use our IRC channel anymore?
- Update the "Current Roadmap" or remove it?

Also maybe we can come up with some improvements to ours by looking at other good READMEs:

  https://github.com/Microsoft/msbuild/blob/master/README.md
  https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/master/README.md
  https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/README.md

Any other ideas are welcome!

This is the SkinnedModel Sample with minimum changes.

After that I will submit a concrete AnimationClipWriter/AnimationClipReader.

data.title: [Pipeline] Set Default Effect
data.body:
Fix #3057 as proposed by @tgjones with some more fixes for bugs that
surfaced.

-Set WeightsPerVertex = 4 for new SkinnedEffect, the default (0) throws
an error when deserialized.
-Fix Build All Textures loop.

data.title: Fixes for FBX importer
data.body:
Here are a few improvements for the FBX importer (OpenAssetImporter).
- The bone weights were only collected up to indicesCount instead of vertexCount. Missing bone weights weren't handled.
- The content pipeline currently only handles indexed triangle lists. But Assimp may return points and lines for degenerate triangles. These degenerate triangles need to be removed.
- The importer now supports skinned model where the root bone has a transformation.
  An example was given here: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3672.

data.title: [Pipeline] Set Default Effect
data.body:
Fix #3057 as proposed by @tgjones with some more fixes for bugs that

an error when deserialized.

data.title: Added DesktopGL as content platform and marked WinGL and Linux as obsolete
data.body: I've also added for the Gtk Pipeline to display [!] if the platform is obsolete.

data.title: Renormalize tangent frame after transformation.
data.body: Tangent frames (normal, tangent, binormal vectors) need to be re-normalized after transformation. This is necessary, for example, when a scale factor is applied to a model in the content pipeline.

data.title: Merged WinGL and Linux OpenTKPlatform and OpenTKWindow
data.body:
Stuff done:
- added DESKTOPGL tag to WinGL and Linux
- setup mouse leave behavior
- added soundcontroller dispose so that the game would close
- removed few peaces of unneeded code

data.title: Monogame WindowsGL ignores keyboard layout.
Merge WindowsGL and Linux Net files
Better window border hangling for OpenTK
Added FrameworkResources
data.body:
Changes :
 -New class FrameworkResources( its internal class from XNA which contains constant strings and other resources for use in multiply places in code).
 -Added FrameworkResources.ResourceCreationWhenDeviceIsNull to all places when graphics resource is created and when graphicsDevice is null in exception message.

data.title: Nvorbis Song.cs for WindowsGL and Linux
Merge WinGL and Linux MonoGame assemblies into one
data.body:
WindowsGL and Linux use almost the exact same code, except for Song.cs(which will for both be replaced by NVorvis) and few #ifs in OpenTKPlatform.cs.

Advantage would be that this should allow one compilation for a game that can be run from both Windows and Linux.
